title: How Rubio Tried to Bring a Pro-Russia Peace Plan to Middle Ground
summary: While President Trump attacked the Ukrainians, Secretary of State Marco Rubio flew to Geneva to seize control of negotiations that were going off the rails.

title: As Ukraine Sets ‘Red Lines,’ a U.S. Peace Plan Is Slimmed Down
summary: Washington and Kyiv said that “highly productive” discussions over a proposal to end the war between Russia and Ukraine would continue.

title: What to Know About Trump’s Peace Plan for Russia and Ukraine
summary: U.S. officials have responded to a storm of criticism about the plan by insisting that it is still a work in progress.

title: Army Chief Says France Must ‘Accept Losing Our Children,’ Igniting Uproar
summary: The furor erupted as President Emmanuel Macron is expected to present a plan for paid, voluntary military service to bolster the armed forces against the threat from Russia.

title: Schumer Faces Pushback From ‘Fight Club’ Group of Senate Democrats
summary: A group of liberal senators is quietly challenging the minority leader over his approach to the midterms and President Trump, in a sign of the party’s deep frustration.

title: Judge Tosses Criminal Charges Against James Comey and Letitia James
summary: The decision is a setback for the president’s efforts to wield the criminal justice system against his perceived enemies.

title: Mark Kelly Under Pentagon Investigation for ‘Illegal Orders’ Video
summary: The defense secretary called the senator’s remarks urging troops not to follow illegal orders “despicable, reckless, and false.”

title: At a Congressional Hearing, Residents Detail the Trauma of the L.A. Raids
summary: More than two dozen people described the upheaval the raids had caused in immigrant communities and aired accusations of mistreatment by agents.

title: Trump Is Considering a Push to Extend Obamacare Subsidies
summary: President Trump has not made a final decision. But he is under pressure to address the cost of health care, which for many Americans will jump if the subsidies expire.

title: How the Coast Guard Revised Its Policy on Swastikas, Nooses and Bullying
summary: After days of backlash, the Homeland Security Department said hateful and violent behavior would not be tolerated.

title: Easy Thanksgiving Recipes | Thanksgiving Recipes 2025 | NYT Cooking
summary: These simple recipes for roast turkey, stuffing, pie crust and more will set you up for a spectacular meal.

title: Mamdani Response to Protest Inflames Tensions with Jewish Leaders
summary: The mayor-elect chastised a synagogue that hosted an event promoting migration to Israel and settlements in occupied territories. His stance further tested his strained relationship with pro-Israel Jews.

title: Health Issues in Middle Age Can Be Linked to Pregnancy Years Earlier
summary: Women with common pregnancy complications are at increased risk for cardiovascular and metabolic health problems later in life. But many patients remain unaware of the connection.

title: Sleep Apnea Linked to Parkinson’s Disease, New Study Finds
summary: Those with the sleep condition were more likely to develop Parkinson’s disease. But one treatment was found to help.

title: Ozempic Drug Fails to Quell Alzheimer’s in Novo Nordisk Trials
summary: The studies were a significant setback for the optimistic view that semaglutide and other GLP-1 drugs could help prevent a number of brain diseases.

title: Viola Fletcher, Oldest Survivor of the Tulsa Race Massacre, Dies at 111
summary: At 7, she bore witness to one of American history’s most violent spasms of racial violence. She was 106 when the nation reckoned with the crime.

title: Ted Danson and Mary Steenburgen Star in a Love Story, Onscreen and Off
summary: Married for three decades, the actors get together as characters in the second season of “A Man on the Inside.”

title: 5 Minutes That Will Make You Love Musicals
summary: Andrew Lloyd Webber, Sara Bareilles, Joshua Henry, Jeanine Tesori, Jason Robert Brown and New York Times writers and editors pick 13 songs to seal the deal.

title: The Incomprehensible March Toward Regime Change in Venezuela
summary: The administration’s drug war rhetoric seems like a pretext. But a pretext for what?

title: America’s Caregivers Are in Crisis
summary: Caregivers are at the brink of despair.

title: ‘Find a Job,’ Ontario Premier Tells Protester While Passing a New Housing Law
summary: During a raucous hearing, the Ontario legislature passed a bill backed by Premier Doug Ford meant to expedite housing development and the eviction of tenants who are behind on their rent.

title: Images From Vietnam’s Year of Deadly Wet Weather
summary: Scientists suggested that climate change could make central Vietnam a global hot spot for destructive storms. This year has seemed to prove the point.

title: ‘Queen of Versailles’ to Close as New Broadway Musicals Struggle
summary: The show, starring Kristin Chenoweth, will remain open through the holidays. The announcement comes just two weeks after the musical opened.
